    • Method Detail

      • connect

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<MqttConnectResult> connect​(java.lang.String host)
        Connect to the specified hostname/ip. By default uses port 1883. If you want to change the port number, see connect(String, int)
        Parameters:
        host - The ip address or host to connect to
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the connection is opened and we received an CONNACK

      • connect

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<MqttConnectResult> connect​(java.lang.String host,
                                                           int port)
        Connect to the specified hostname/ip using the specified port
        Parameters:
        host - The ip address or host to connect to
        port - The tcp port to connect to
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the connection is opened and we received an CONNACK

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if channel is active

      • reconnect

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<MqttConnectResult> reconnect()
        Attempt reconnect to the host that was attempted with connect(String, int) method before
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the connection is opened and we received an CONNACK
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no previous connect(String, int) calls were attempted

      • getEventLoop

        io.netty.channel.EventLoopGroup getEventLoop()
        Retrieve the netty EventLoopGroup we are using
        Returns:
        The netty EventLoopGroup we use for the connection

      • setEventLoop

        void setEventLoop​(io.netty.channel.EventLoopGroup eventLoop)
        By default we use the netty NioEventLoopGroup. If you change the EventLoopGroup to another type, make sure to change the Channel class using MqttClientConfig.setChannelClass(Class) If you want to force the MqttClient to use another EventLoopGroup, call this function before calling connect(String, int)
        Parameters:
        eventLoop - The new eventloop to use

      • on

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> on​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                   MqttHandler handler)
        Subscribe on the given topic. When a message is received, MqttClient will invoke the MqttHandler.onMessage(String, ByteBuf) function of the given handler
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic filter to subscribe to
        handler - The handler to invoke when we receive a message
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the server acknowledges our subscribe request

      • on

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> on​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                   MqttHandler handler,
                                                   io.netty.handler.codec.mqtt.MqttQoS qos)
        Subscribe on the given topic, with the given qos. When a message is received, MqttClient will invoke the MqttHandler.onMessage(String, ByteBuf) function of the given handler
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic filter to subscribe to
        handler - The handler to invoke when we receive a message
        qos - The qos to request to the server
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the server acknowledges our subscribe request

      • once

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> once​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                     MqttHandler handler)
        Subscribe on the given topic. When a message is received, MqttClient will invoke the MqttHandler.onMessage(String, ByteBuf) function of the given handler This subscription is only once. If the MqttClient has received 1 message, the subscription will be removed
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic filter to subscribe to
        handler - The handler to invoke when we receive a message
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the server acknowledges our subscribe request

      • once

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> once​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                     MqttHandler handler,
                                                     io.netty.handler.codec.mqtt.MqttQoS qos)
        Subscribe on the given topic, with the given qos. When a message is received, MqttClient will invoke the MqttHandler.onMessage(String, ByteBuf) function of the given handler This subscription is only once. If the MqttClient has received 1 message, the subscription will be removed
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic filter to subscribe to
        handler - The handler to invoke when we receive a message
        qos - The qos to request to the server
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the server acknowledges our subscribe request

      • off

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> off​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                    MqttHandler handler)
        Remove the subscription for the given topic and handler If you want to unsubscribe from all handlers known for this topic, use off(String)
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to unsubscribe for
        handler - The handler to unsubscribe
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the server acknowledges our unsubscribe request

      • off

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> off​(java.lang.String topic)
        Remove all subscriptions for the given topic. If you want to specify which handler to unsubscribe, use off(String, MqttHandler)
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to unsubscribe for
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the server acknowledges our unsubscribe request

      • publish

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> publish​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                        io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf payload)
        Publish a message to the given payload
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to publish to
        payload - The payload to send
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the message is sent out of the MqttClient

      • publish

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> publish​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                        io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf payload,
                                                        io.netty.handler.codec.mqtt.MqttQoS qos)
        Publish a message to the given payload, using the given qos
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to publish to
        payload - The payload to send
        qos - The qos to use while publishing
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the message is delivered to the server

      • publish

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> publish​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                        io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf payload,
                                                        boolean retain)
        Publish a message to the given payload, using optional retain
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to publish to
        payload - The payload to send
        retain - true if you want to retain the message on the server, false otherwise
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the message is sent out of the MqttClient

      • publish

        io.netty.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> publish​(java.lang.String topic,
                                                        io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf payload,
                                                        io.netty.handler.codec.mqtt.MqttQoS qos,
                                                        boolean retain)
        Publish a message to the given payload, using the given qos and optional retain
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to publish to
        payload - The payload to send
        qos - The qos to use while publishing
        retain - true if you want to retain the message on the server, false otherwise
        Returns:
        A future which will be completed when the message is delivered to the server

      • getClientConfig

        MqttClientConfig getClientConfig()
        Retrieve the MqttClient configuration
        Returns:
        The MqttClientConfig instance we use

      • create

        static MqttClient create​(MqttClientConfig config,
                         MqttHandler defaultHandler)
        Construct the MqttClientImpl with additional config. This config can also be changed using the getClientConfig() function
        Parameters:
        config - The config object to use while looking for settings
        defaultHandler - The handler for incoming messages that do not match any topic subscriptions

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Send disconnect and close channel

      • setCallback

        void setCallback​(MqttClientCallback callback)
        Sets the see #MqttClientCallback object for this MqttClient param callback The callback to be set
